instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP3V3_G3S: What is PP3V3_G3S? PP3V3_G3S is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3S standby state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> draws 20volts and 0.06mA
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.63 V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> 5.1 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> 3.3 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S</SIGNAL> 3.3V
ALL SSD rails are present and the PMU LDO'S. Try to restore with apple configurator 2 and got this error:
The System cannot be restored on this device.

Unexpected device state 'DFU' expected Recovery' (Probably forced into DFU mock externally) [com.apple.MobileDevice.Mobile Restore

- OXFAE (4014)]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> draws 20volts and 0.06mA
threads.message: Target machine appears directly into AC2, without typing DFU keys sequence?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> draws 20volts and 0.06mA
threads.message: No..until I press the DFU combination keys.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> draws 20volts and 0.06mA
threads.message:
Any SSD voltage present?
If not, check diode mode on its power rails.

You can try to reflash <CHIP>U4770</CHIP> and see if complete DFU after that.
